intro: Didissandra fritschii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has a distinctive, serpentine stem and produces fruits that are covered in hooked spines. Its leaves are opposite and have a velvety texture, while its flowers emit a strong, sweet fragrance to attract pollinators. Didissandra fritschii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and nocturnal blooming habit.
